byline.original: By A. G. SULZBERGER and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Bishop Robert W Fin and the Diocese of Kansas City-St Joseph are indicted for failing to report suspected child abuse; is first time in 25-year history of Roman Catholic Church's sex abuse scandals that leader of an American diocese has been held criminally liable for the behavior of a priest he supervised.
snippet: The indictment of Robert Finn is the first of a Roman Catholic bishop in the 25 years since the scandal over sexual abuse by priests first became public in the United States.
lead_paragraph: The indictment of Robert Finn is the first of a Roman Catholic bishop in the 25 years since the scandal over sexual abuse by priests first became public in the United States.

headline.main: Bishop Indicted; Charge Is Failing to Report Abuse
